sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
To the Right Honourable the Lords and Commons in the high court of Parliament now assembled the humble petition of the well affected prentices and yong-men of the City of London and suburbs.
1 sheet ([1] p.)
Printed for John Johnson, London : in the yeere. 1642.
Praying Parliament "to leave no just way unatempted which may conduce to the settlement of differences." Wing gives publication date 1642/3 but Thomason received his copy in December, 1642. With engraved border. Annotation on Thomason copy: "Decemb. 22". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
To the Right Honourable the Lords and Commons in the high court of Parliament now assembled the humble petition of the well affected prentices and yong-men of the City of London and suburbs.
1 sheet ([1] p.)
Printed for John Johnson, London : in the yeere. 1642.
Praying Parliament "to leave no just way unatempted which may conduce to the settlement of differences." Wing gives publication date 1642/3 but Thomason received his copy in December, 1642. With engraved border. Annotation on Thomason copy: "Decemb. 22". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
John Johnson
>>>>>>> imprintparse
